title: Space Force not buying large satellites for the foreseeable future
summary: The era of massive satellites needs to be in the rear view mirror for the Department of Defense, the head of military space acquisitions Frank Calvelli said Jan. 24.

title: NASA and DARPA to partner on nuclear thermal propulsion demonstration
summary: NASA and DARPA will cooperate on the development and flight demonstration of a nuclear propulsion system with applications for both national security and space exploration.

title: Buckle up, it could get bumpy: The space economy’s vaunted resilience will be tested in 2023
summary: While challenging economic conditions this year will hit some space companies harder than others, the industry as a whole is expected to remain robust as multiple headwinds rock the sector.

title: European launch chief insists there be no competition with Ariane rockets
summary: "A huge mistake would be that this focus on microlaunchers destabilizes Ariane 6 and Vega C."

title: Thales Alenia Space leading another ESA push to develop quantum comms
summary: Thales Alenia Space has signed a contract to develop quantum technologies in another push by the European Space Agency to use the behavior of subatomic particles to make communications more secure.

title: Quindar raises seed round to provide mission management software services
summary: A startup has raised $2.5 million in seed funding to further development of a software system to make it easier for companies to operate satellite constellations.

title: Rocket Lab to conduct first Electron launch from American soil
summary: Rocket Lab, which has operated its Electron small-satellite launcher successfully from New Zealand since 2017, will soon inaugurate its first US-based launch site. After weather and paperwork-related delays, the mission named “Virginia Is For Launch Lovers” is now set to lift off within a two-hour window beginning at 6:00 PM EST (23:00 UTC) on Tuesday, Jan. 24.

title: SpaceX completes major Starship test in prep for rocket’s first orbital launch attempt
summary: SpaceX announced on Monday it completed a major test of its latest Starship prototype, as the company prepares for the first orbital launch of the towering rocket.

title: SpaceX completes Starship wet dress rehearsal
summary: SpaceX conducted a fueling test of its full Starship launch vehicle Jan. 23, taking the vehicle one step closer to its first orbital launch attempt.

title: Channeling frustration into program management software
summary: Charter, one of six space companies that participated in the fall 2022 Techstars Aerospace and Defense Accelerator, has raised $1.2 million in venture funding from TechStars, 7percent Ventures, Topspot Ventures and other investors.
